name: Skinny
body: Galvanic skin response device for classroom and field use. # How to Use this Thing ## Quick Instructions Here is how to run an experiment with the Skinny. Assumes the Skinny is charged and the SD card is inserted. 1. attach probes to person (use Signa Creme) ![](https://github.iu.edu/PBS-TSG/Skinny/raw/gh-pages/images/using1.png) 2. attach probes to Skinny (either direction works) ![](https://github.iu.edu/PBS-TSG/Skinny/raw/gh-pages/images/jacks.png) 3. scroll to `Record Continuous` or `Record Epoch` then press the button to choose this option 4. During recording, the display should indicate a file number such as `1C.CSV` if you're in Continuous mode, or an epoch number if in Epoch mode. ![](https://github.iu.edu/PBS-TSG/Skinny/raw/gh-pages/images/using2.png) 5. when done, a long press (2 seconds) on the button will exit the recording mode and return you to the menu ## Detailed Instructions [User Manual]() ## Laboratory / Principal Investigator / Faculty [Ben Motz](http://psych.indiana.edu/faculty/bmotz.php) ## [Engineers](http://psych.indiana.edu/staffdirectory.php#8) * [Alex Shroyer](https://github.com/hoosieree) * Jeff Sturgeon * Tony Walker #### Features * AgCl electrodes (2) * 1.8" color TFT screen * micro SD card for data collection * rechargeable battery (charge through micro USB) ## Revision History * 1.0.0 - 2013/08/09 - Initial project complete * 1.0.1 - 2014/06/27 - Begin version 2.0 * 0.2.1 - 2014/06/28 - Prototype hardware assembled * 0.2.1 - 2014/07/07 - Porting to Teensy 3.1 * 2.0.0 - 2014/09/05 - 2.0 device delivered to students
